channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jakeludington @elonmusk @Medium The problem with that question is it assumes Medium is offering the same thing I'm asking for and they are not.
@chipgoines i'm sorry -- what's your point? i'm having trouble wading through your bitter sarcasm. ;-)

Okay here's a Twitter package I'd pay for and so would a lot of other people. Call it Twitter Pro. Features: 1. Posts can have titles. 2. Simple styling. 3. Links. 4. Podcasts. 5. Unlimited length. $10 per month. I'd pay. Without a moment's hesitation. cc: @elonmusk.

A thread runs through most of the coverage of the new Twitter run by Musk -- that is: 1. Musk is stupid. Of course he's not stupid. No one that rises to a unique position of wealth, power or fame is. If you came to that conclusion, throw it out, because it's wrong.

Journalists are creatively dysfunctional part 11,287. Twitter is a huge powerful platform with lots of unexplored applications. Of course he can double revenue through subscriptions. You have to imagine other applications for the platform. https://t.co/GTGD1XfJOy
For a comp, consider how much revenue there is for the iOS platform. And how much revenue would you have thought was possible in 2007?
Twitter has never been run as a business. That's why there's so much upside.
Journalists think they know everything. That's the other big bug.
Another comp. People pay Tesla, another Musk company, $10K to subscribe to their full self driving functionality. I don't know how they got me to do it, I'm one of those people. ;-)
Twitter, if you were using it in the early years, had a huge problem in getting the system to work at scale. So they focused on that above all else for years. Then they got it to scale, it works really well now. And then they had other scaling problems to deal with (trolls).
They've never had the time to take a fresh look and focus on turning it into a business and a real developer platform. It may not seem fair, but a new CEO with lots of experience squeezing big money out of tech products might be able to do this.
Extra Bonus Quote of the Day. https://t.co/WmaXZFGigQ

@stevesilberman @rushkoff The best bagels where I grew up was in bay terrace shopping center, but since I left home one of the best places in the city is Utopia Bagels on Utopia Pkway in Whitestone. https://t.co/PobPFuCPz4
@rushkoff @stevesilberman Where did you grow up? I was in flushing. Did we ever talk about that?
Triumph The Insult Comic Dog On Hollywood Squares. https://t.co/q3d1OhsE2V
These GOP Senate candidates oppose most exceptions to abortion bans. https://t.co/NiDgjk54HT
@HarrisonFjord9 @JoeBiden @DNC Heh, yeah they might not get that. 🤪

Our politicians are such artificial people the president can’t express legit rage at what the Repubs are doing to our country. He’s reminiscing about bipartisanship, when he should be putting them down, destroying them, no compromise.
He dreams of the old south, the plantation and mammy and her long underwear. He imagines himself as Rhett butler, and Moscow Mitch as Miss Scarlet.
He finally is fed up and says to Mitch...
https://t.co/a2v00n6V9I
@amrith In Madison when I was a student there, they served white bread at the Chinese restaurant near the CS building.
Wait a minute was @sarasquirm on last night's SNL? https://t.co/6TIOJcPbhp
@jeremyzilar Same here.
NYT RSS Feeds. https://t.co/f9Nb3t0sDC
@pilhofer This is fascinating. Normally I'd agree with the sign on the right, but I live in a place where you don't know about the neighbor. The family on the left *is* making an important statement.

1/4 I fear for Ukraine. What happens when we decide it's over even when the war is still raging, as we have done with Covid, not caring how many people's lives will be ruined, or ended.
2/4 I expect it'll be the same with Roe v Wade, until we really get woke and see the big picture. We need societal mechanisms to stay focused on what matters, and not lose the focus in meaningful ways, until the problem is solved or the threat is over.
3/4 Lots of other things fall into that bucket btw: climate change, regulating guns in the US, black lives matter, LGBTQ rights. We only focus briefly, leaving us vulnerable to dishonest power-hungry people who are more patient.
4/4 Social networks can help, but only ones that are carefully crafted to stay focused on the goal they are assigned to. Twitter and Facebook et al were invented and bootstrapped in chaos. I understand this process as well as anyone. There are other ways to do it.

Happy Mother's Day. Richard Nixon used to say his mother was a saint. I always thought that was weird, because I could tell she was not a saint, because you have to be pretty fucked up to raise a Nixon. Nixon hated himself, you could tell. Where do you think he learned that?
Fox News deals in Kremlin propaganda. So why not freeze Rupert Murdoch’s assets? https://t.co/7CXnqMWFWo
“The World is a Corporation.” https://t.co/JQ4eG2ApHl
U.S. police trainers with far-right ties are teaching hundreds of cops. https://t.co/evfmoaVyTc
@Peter_Wehner https://t.co/zsfKu1C62G
